column5: So as some of you might know i was looking for a good place to shore fish with my dad. I found one on Simcoe called Jacksons point. Dont know if anyone's heard of it or fished it but if so hows the fishing and how busy is it usually? Heres a link to it : http://www.fishinglakesimcoe.ca/Hotspots/S...on-s-Point.html

Good luck, I haven't fished it myself but I'm pretty sure you'll find lots on Simcoe if you do a search.  I do remember that one of the complaints is that there are fewer and fewer shore access spots on Simcoe because of resident complaints.  Mike

I would think it's the wrong time of year to fish there I would think you would do better on the canal in keswick,  the mouth of the trent just north of beaverton there are also a few spots on the holland river to fish from shore, I see them when fishing from a boat but don;t know how they access the spots, but all should be better then Jackson point this time of year
You could try the mouth of the Talbot river just around the corner from Beaverton. Kenny G.
